intro: Phyllostegia glabra var. glabra, commonly known as the smoothleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their mild astringent properties.
